https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Understanding the combination of geologic processes that are required to form and preserve ore deposits at all scales. It recognises seven critical geological processes: source of mineralizing fluid, source of metals, fluid pathway, thermal gradient, energy source, structural focusing of fluids, and chemical or physical trap for metal precipitation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definition adapted from:
1) McCuaig, TC, Beresford, S and Hronsky, J 2010, Translating the mineral systems approach into an effective exploration targeting system: Ore Geology Reviews, v. 38, p. 128–138.
2) Wyborn, LAI, Heinrich, CA and Jaques, AL 1994, Australian Proterozoic mineral systems: Essential ingredients and mappable criteria: Proceedings of the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy Annual Conference, Darwin, 5–9 August 1994, p. 109–115.
